intro: Haynaldia hordeacea, commonly known as the barley grass, is a flowering plant in the Poaceae family. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found growing in disturbed soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is known for its high nutritional value and is sometimes used in herbal medicine. Haynaldia hordeacea is also cultivated as a forage crop for livestock.
